1.name: It Happened One Night
1.description: A spoiled heiress running away from her family is helped by a man who is actually a reporter in need of a story.

2.name: Tarzan and His Mate
2.description: The idyllic life of Tarzan and Jane is challenged by men on safari who come seeking ivory, and come seeking Jane as well.

3.name: The Thin Man
3.description: Former detective Nick Charles and his wealthy wife Nora investigate a murder case, mostly for the fun of it.

4.name: Imitation of Life
4.description: A struggling widow and her daughter take in a black housekeeper and her fair-skinned daughter; the two women start a successful business, but face familial, identity, and racial issues along the way.

5.name: The Man Who Knew Too Much
5.description: A man and his wife receive a clue to an imminent assassination attempt, only to learn that their daughter has been kidnapped to keep them quiet.

6.name: Of Human Bondage
6.description: A young man finds himself attracted to a cold and unfeeling waitress who may ultimately destroy them both.

7.name: Babes in Toyland
7.description: Opposing the evil Barnaby, Ollie Dee and Stanley Dum try and fail to pay-off Mother Peep's mortgage and mislead his attempts to marry Little Bo. Enraged, Barnaby's Bogeymen are set on Toyland.

8.name: L'Atalante
8.description: Newly married couple Juliette and a ship captain Jean struggle through marriage as they travel on the L'atalante along with the captain's first mate Le père Jules and a cabin boy.

9.name: The Scarlet Pimpernel
9.description: A noblewoman discovers her husband is The Scarlet Pimpernel, a vigilante who rescues aristocrats from the blade of the guillotine.

10.name: The Black Cat
10.description: American honeymooners in Hungary become trapped in the home of a Satan-worshiping priest when the bride is taken there for medical help following a road accident.

11.name: The Scarlet Empress
11.description: A German noblewoman enters into a loveless marriage with the dim-witted, unstable heir to the Russian throne, then plots to oust him from power.

12.name: The Gay Divorcee
12.description: An American woman travels to England to seek a divorce from her absentee husband, where she meets - and falls for - a dashing performer.

13.name: Here Comes the Navy
13.description: A cocky guy joins the Navy for the wrong reason but finds romance and twice is cited for heroism.

14.name: The Man from Utah
14.description: In a horse-riding rodeo contest bad guys want John Weston to lose. When he doesn't go along they add some insurance: a poisoned needle just under his saddle.

15.name: Cleopatra
15.description: The man-hungry Queen of Egypt leads Julius Caesar and Mark Antony astray, amid scenes of DeMillean splendor.

16.name: Death Takes a Holiday
16.description: The Grim Reaper (Frederic March) takes the form of a Prince in an attempt to relate to humans and, along the way, also learns what it is to love.

17.name: The Count of Monte Cristo
17.description: After greedy men have Edmound Dantes unjustly imprisoned for 20 years for innocently delivering a letter entrusted to him, he escapes to get his revenge on them.

18.name: Dames
18.description: A multimillionaire decides to boycott "filthy" forms of entertainment such as Broadway shows.

19.name: Anne of Green Gables
19.description: A romantic teenage girl is adopted by a pair of elderly siblings in turn-of-the-century Canada.

20.name: Blue Steel
20.description: U.S. marshal John Carruthers observes a robbery and Sheriff Jake thinks he may be the culprit. Meanwhile the town's leading citizen is planning to rob everybody blind.

21.name: 'Neath the Arizona Skies
21.description: A little Indian girl, heiress to a fortune in oil, is kidnapped.

22.name: The Lucky Texan
22.description: Jerry Mason, a young Texan, and Jake Benson, an old rancher, become partners and strike it rich with a gold mine. They then find their lives complicated by bad guys and a woman.

23.name: Twentieth Century
23.description: A flamboyant Broadway impresario who has fallen on hard times tries to get his former lover, now a Hollywood diva, to return and resurrect his failing career.

24.name: Manhattan Melodrama
24.description: The friendship between two orphans endures even though they grow up on opposite sides of the law and fall in love with the same woman.

25.name: It's a Gift
25.description: A henpecked New Jersey grocer makes plans to move to California to grow oranges, despite the resistance of his overbearing wife.

26.name: The Merry Widow
26.description: When a small kingdom's main tax payer leaves for Paris, its king dispatches a dashing count to win back her allegiance.

27.name: Flirtation Walk
27.description: A Musical-romance with Dick Powell as a private stationed in Hawaii who gets involved with Ruby Keeler, the general's engaged daughter. In order to avoid a scandal, the pair break up, but ...                See full summary »

28.name: The Lawless Frontier
28.description: Mexican outlaw Zanti killed John Tobin's parents. John teams up with Dusty, also hurt by Zanti, to get the bad guy.

29.name: Randy Rides Alone
29.description: Jailed for murders he didn't commit, Randy escapes only to stumble into the den of the real murderers.

30.name: Bright Eyes
30.description: An orphaned girl is taken in by a snobbish family at the insistence of their rich, crotchety uncle, even as her devoted aviator godfather fights for custody.

31.name: Music Hall
31.description: A group of theatre workers and artistes come together to organize a Variety Benefit evening for an ailing Music Hall.

32.name: Judge Priest
32.description: Judge Priest, a proud Confederate veteran, uses common sense and considerable humanity to dispense justice in a small town in the Post-Bellum Kentucky.

33.name: The Lost Patrol
33.description: A dozen British soldiers, lost in a Mesopotamian desert during World War I, are menaced by unseen Arab enemies.

34.name: Hips, Hips, Hooray!
34.description: Two salesmen try to market a flavored lipstick.

35.name: Treasure Island
35.description: Young Jim Hawkins is torn between his loyalty to his benefactors and his affection for lovable rogue Long John Silver in their struggle to recover a buried pirate treasure.

36.name: Maniac
36.description: A former vaudevillian gifted at impersonation assists a mad scientist in reanimating corpses and soon goes mad himself.

37.name: Wonder Bar
37.description: Harry and Inez are a dance team at the Wonder Bar. Inez loves Harry, but he is in love with Liane, the wife of a wealthy business man. Al Wonder and the conductor/singer Tommy are in love ...                See full summary »

38.name: Now and Forever
38.description: A swindler and his girlfriend take in his young daughter, who has been living with the family of his deceased wife.

39.name: The House of Rothschild
39.description: The wealthy Rothschild family undergoes prejudice from the anti-Semitic society they live within.

40.name: The Man Who Changed His Name
40.description: A cheating wife and her lover conspire to swindle her wealthy husband out of valuable property in Canada. But soon come to believe the man not only is on to them, but under another name ...                See full summary »

41.name: The Painted Veil
41.description: A wife neglected by her husband, a medical researcher in China, falls in love with a dashing diplomatic attaché.

42.name: The Barretts of Wimpole Street
42.description: Elizabeth Barrett's tyrannical father has forbidden any of his family to marry. Nevertheless, Elizabeth falls in love with the poet Robert Browning.

43.name: Born to Be Bad
43.description: An immoral mother blackmails a wealthy businessman after he accidentally hits her delinquent son with his truck.

44.name: The Trail Beyond
44.description: Rod Drew hunts for a missing girl and finds himself in a fight over a goldmine as well.

45.name: Les misérables
45.description: The lives of numerous people over the course of 20 years in 19th century France, weaved together by the story of an ex-convict named Jean Valjean on the run from an obsessive police inspector, who pursues him for only a minor offense.

46.name: The Star Packer
46.description: A gang working for The Shadow is terrorizing the town. John Travers decides to take on the job of sheriff and do something about it.

47.name: Waltzes from Vienna
47.description: The story of Johann Strauss the elder and younger.

48.name: Viva Villa!
48.description: After enacting revenge on the overseer who murdered his father, Pancho Villa becomes a bandit, earning the respect of the poor by brutally attacking the wealthy.

49.name: Orient Express
49.description: Based on Graham Greene's novel Stamboul Train, the movie focuses on the lives of individuals aboard the Orient Express as it makes a three-day journey from Ostend to Constantinople. The ...                See full summary »

50.name: Search for Beauty
50.description: Three con artists dupe two Olympians into serving as editors of a new health and beauty magazine which is only a front for salacious stories and pictures.
